meanings.definition: To behave in an ingratiating or servile manner.
meanings.sent1: He smarmed his way into getting a promotion at work.
meanings.sent2: She always smarmed up to the boss to get what she wanted.
meanings.sent3: The salesman smarmed the customer into buying the expensive product.
meanings.sent4: The politician smarmed his constituents with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The cat smarmed its way into getting extra treats from its owner.

meanings.sent1: The celebrity smarmed the interviewer with compliments.
meanings.sent2: She smarmed her way into the director's good graces.
meanings.sent3: The student smarmed the teacher to get a better grade.
meanings.sent4: His words smarmed her like honey, making her feel special.
meanings.sent5: The child smarmed their parents to buy them a new toy.

meanings.definition: To use flattery or charm in order to manipulate or deceive.
meanings.sent1: The con artist smarmed his way into the old lady's trust.
meanings.sent2: She smarmed her colleagues to get them to do her work.
meanings.sent3: The fox smarmed the crow into dropping the cheese.
meanings.sent4: Her smile smarmed him into revealing his secrets.
meanings.sent5: The villain smarmed his henchmen into doing his bidding.
